sources.title: LadyofBurlesque
sources.description: Barbara Stanwyck portrays Dixie Daisy, a striptease artist at a Broadway theater in New York at the end of the 1930s. In the course of fending off the unwanted advances of brash comic Biff Brannigan (Michael O'Shea), with whom she is teamed in several numbers, and staying clear of the dressing room feuds of her fellow dancers.

sources.title: Lady of Burlesque (1943) [Comedy] [Horror]
sources.description:
Lady of Burlesque (also known as "The G-String Murders" and in the UK, "Striptease Lady") is a 1943 American mystery film, based on the novel The "G-String Murders" written by strip tease artist Gypsy Rose Lee (with ghost-writing assistance from mystery writer Craig Rice). The plot concerns the murder of two strippers, backstage of a New York burlesque theatre and the detection of the killer.

The film is a faithful, if sanitized due to the censorship of the time, adaptation of the original novel, although Gypsy Rose Lee, who appears as a character in her own book, is here renamed "Dixie Daisy" (Stanwyck). Michael O'Shea plays her romantic interest, comedian Biff Brannigan, and Iris Adrian portrays a showgirl. Pinky Lee, a burlesque comic in real life, is another notable supporting player, as is Gerald Mohr as villain Louie Grindero. The film depicted as much as the censors would allow with respect to the precise nature of "bumps" and "grinds", and the slapdash nature of burlesque shows.

---

Directed by William A. Wellman, produced by Hunt Stromberg, written by James Gunn and Craig Rice, starring Barbara Stanwyck, Michael O'Shea and Iris Adrian.

---

Source: "Lady of Burlesque" Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.. 1 May 2013. Web. 12 June 2013. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lady_of_Burlesque.

If you like this movie and our channel, please subscribe: https://goo.gl/0qDmXe

sources.title: Lady of Burlesque (1943) | Colorized Public Domain Classic with Barbara Stanwyck & Michael O‚ÄôShea
sources.description:
Lady of Burlesque (1943) is an American musical mystery comedy directed by William A. Wellman and based on the novel The G-String Murders by famed burlesque star Gypsy Rose Lee. This colorized and restored edition revives a film that blends showbiz glamour, sharp wit, and a thrilling murder mystery. Originally shot in black and white, our enhanced color version makes the dazzling costumes, backstage chaos, and sultry performances more vivid and accessible to modern audiences in the USA, Europe, and worldwide.

Plot Summary:
The story is set in the vibrant but precarious world of burlesque, centering on Dixie Daisy (Barbara Stanwyck), a smart and independent performer who captivates audiences with her talent and charm. Behind the stage lights, however, rivalries, jealousies, and secrets simmer among the dancers and comedians of the theater. When a series of shocking strangulation murders occurs‚Äîusing exotic costumes as the murder weapon‚Äîsuspicion and paranoia spread rapidly through the troupe. Dixie teams up with fellow performer Biff Brannigan (Michael O‚ÄôShea), a fast-talking comic with street smarts, to uncover the truth.

As Dixie navigates gossip, danger, and her budding romance with Biff, the film delivers both humor and suspense. Each performance number and backstage moment adds layers to the whodunit, culminating in a dramatic reveal that exposes the killer‚Äôs identity. With its mix of music, dance, romance, and noir-style mystery, Lady of Burlesque offers a unique glimpse into 1940s entertainment culture.

Cast and Crew:
‚Ä¢ Director: William A. Wellman
‚Ä¢ Based on: The G-String Murders (novel) by Gypsy Rose Lee
‚Ä¢ Screenplay: James Gunn
‚Ä¢ Cinematography: Robert De Grasse
‚Ä¢ Editing: James E. Newcom
Starring:
‚Ä¢ Barbara Stanwyck as Dixie Daisy
‚Ä¢ Michael O‚ÄôShea as Biff Brannigan
‚Ä¢ J. Edward Bromberg as S.B. Foss
‚Ä¢ Iris Adrian as Gee Gee Graham
‚Ä¢ Gloria Dickson as Dolly Baxter
‚Ä¢ Charles Dingle as Inspector Harrigan
‚Ä¢ Victoria Faust as Princess Nirvena
‚Ä¢ Marion Martin as Lola
‚Ä¢ Stephanie Bachelor as Blossom Terraine

Film Significance:
Lady of Burlesque stands out as one of Barbara Stanwyck‚Äôs most memorable 1940s roles, showcasing her versatility as both a dramatic and comedic actress. Its mixture of backstage musical and murder mystery was unusual for its time, giving audiences both spectacle and suspense. Directed by Academy Award-winner William Wellman (Wings, The Public Enemy), the film is an example of Hollywood‚Äôs fascination with burlesque culture during the war years. Today, it remains a cult favorite for fans of classic mysteries and vintage showbiz stories.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Lady of Burlesque remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for today‚Äôs viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The original 1943 release was in black and white, standard for the period. While historically authentic, modern viewers‚Äîespecially those watching on large TVs in the USA and Europe‚Äîoften skip over black-and-white films. Our colorized edition bridges that gap, giving new vibrancy to the costumes, stage numbers, and the tense mystery at the heart of the story.

sources.title: Lady of Burlesque (1943) BARBARA STANWYCK
sources.description:
Stars: Barbara Stanwyck, Michael O'Shea and Iris Adrian
Director: William A. Wellman
Writers: Gypsy Rose Lee (novel)

A striptease artist becomes the prime suspect when two dancers are found strangled by their own g-strings!  Based on the novel "The G-String Murders" by Gypsy Rose Lee.

sources.title: Lady of Burlesque (1943) Mystery, Musical | Barbara Stanwyck, Michael O'Shea | Full Movie
sources.description:
Bold Murder... Bare Truths... Secrets Unveiled! 
After one member of their group is murdered, the performers at a burlesque house must work together to find out who the killer is before they strike again.

metadata.Plot: Sassy Dixie Daisy is the hot new attraction at a former opera house that's been turned into a burlesque theater. She's popular with the customers, although not with Lolita La Verne, a stuck-up diva who was hoping she'd get the top spot. Also complicating matters is the return of the Princess Nirvena, the show's former star who once had a fling with the boss. When the Princess blackmails her way into the top spot, Dixie is none too pleased. When both Lolita and the Princess are murdered, Dixie becomes a prime suspect. She then sets up a trap to nail the real killer.
metadata.Actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Michael O'Shea, Iris Adrian
